definition: (acknowledged) place/a role to play/niche
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Xi
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]

sentences.english: Still, low-cost airlines have established a special place in Asia's travel industry.
sentences.chinese: 如此，廉價航空在亞洲的旅遊市場了的一席之地。

sentences.english: "Gong Xi Poetry, " which is also a place.
sentences.chinese: 《鞏溪詩話》在其中也佔有一席之地。

sentences.english: To choose the catchword of 2008, Simulated Culture must be included.
sentences.chinese: 評選2008年流行語，“山寨”當有一席之地。

sentences.english: Self-help books have carved quite a niche out of it.
sentences.chinese: 自我剖析的書籍佔有一席之地。

sentences.english: Tools have their place, but there's no substitute for skill and experience.
sentences.chinese: 工具有自己的一席之地，但不能替代技能和經驗。

sentences.english: Congratulations. You have just qualified for a place on the play group committee.
sentences.chinese: 恭喜你，現在你有資格在遊戲同盟中擁有一席之地了。

sentences.english: Might war games deserve a greater role in business?
sentences.chinese: 實戰演習是否能夠在商業中佔有一席之地呢？

sentences.english: He's keeping his place in the team because he deserves to keep his place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 我將會在球隊中保有一席之地，因爲他值得。

sentences.english: The Bianconeri can also help me to win back my place in the Selecao.
sentences.chinese: 尤文圖斯可以幫我在巴西國家隊贏得一席之地。

sentences.english: Overseas Chinese scholars should possess a position in Chinese modern academic history.
sentences.chinese: 海外華裔學人在中國現代學術史上應占有一席之地。

sentences.english: By her hard work she won a place for herself.
sentences.chinese: 她靠工作努力贏得一席之地。

sentences.english: And nationally, blending learning has already caught on in some areas.
sentences.chinese: 而在全國範圍內，混合教學法早就佔據了一席之地。

sentences.english: In the Scottish army the kilts are used as part of the ceremonial uniform.
sentences.chinese: 在蘇格蘭軍隊的儀式制服中，方格裙也佔有一席之地。

sentences.english: In 1999, Michael earned a spot on the U. S. National B Team.
sentences.chinese: 1999年，邁克爾在美國國家二隊佔得了一席之地。

sentences.english: Deeply did I feel privileged in having a place in your heart.
sentences.chinese: 我能在你心中佔有一席之地使我感到深爲榮幸。

sentences.english: So there is a niche for science in the UN system.
sentences.chinese: 因此科學在這個聯合國系統裏有一席之地。

definition: to have/to own/to hold/to occupy/to possess/to account for (a high proportion etc)
position/status/place/CL:個|个[ge4]
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to play a critical role (idiom)/influential
most outstanding/par excellence
half of the country (esp. when half the country has fallen into enemy hands)/vast swathe of territory
to occupy/to hold
well-known figure/excellent (person, company etc)

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
to reveal one's talent (idiom)/to rise above others/to distinguish oneself
lit. a cup of soup/fig. to get part of the profits/one's share of the action
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
key moment/decisive opportunity
